tool.name: create_sbb

param.name: in_PF
param.dialogReference: Input feature layer or feature class representing Procedural Features (PFs). This must have a valid Source Feature ID field with unique values for each feature.

param.name: fld_SFID
param.dialogReference: Source Feature ID field, used to link each PF to its corresponding SBB in the output.

param.name: fld_Rule
param.dialogReference: Rule field, used to determine how the SBB is generated.

param.name: fld_Buff
param.dialogReference: Buffer field, used to determine the size of the buffer around PFs, where applicable.

param.name: out_SBB
param.dialogReference: Output feature class containing Site Building Blocks (SBBs)

param.name: scratch_GDB
param.dialogReference:
Scratch geodatabase specified to store temporary/intermediate data.

If not specified, intermediate data will be stored in memory and will not persist; this is preferred for faster processing. It is recommended that you only specify a scratch geodatabase if you need to trouble-shoot poor automation results, or if your computer has insufficient memory for processing large datasets.

tool.summary:
Creates Site Building Blocks (SBBs) for input Procedural Features (PFs), subsetting and applying rules as needed.

Usage Notes:

  • This tool does not test to determine if all of the input Procedural Features should be subject to a particular rule. The user must ensure that this is so.

  • It is recommended that the National Wetland Inventory (NWI) feature classes be stored on your local drive rather than a network drive, to optimize processing speed.

  • The input NWI data must contain a field indicating applicable to the particular rule.

  • For best results, it is recommended that you close all other programs before running this tool, since it relies on having ample memory for processing.

dataIdInfo.idAbs:
Creates Site Building Blocks (SBBs) for input Procedural Features (PFs), subsetting and applying rules as needed.

Usage Notes:

  • This tool does not test to determine if all of the input Procedural Features should be subject to a particular rule. The user must ensure that this is so.

  • It is recommended that the National Wetland Inventory (NWI) feature classes be stored on your local drive rather than a network drive, to optimize processing speed.

  • The input NWI data must contain a subset of only those features applicable to the particular rule. Adjacent NWI features should have boundaries dissolved.

  • For best results, it is recommended that you close all other programs before running this tool, since it relies on having ample memory for processing.
dataIdInfo.idCredit: Kirsten R. Hazler (Virginia Natural Heritage Program)
